basics.name: Dylan
basics.label: Software Engineer && Student
basics.headline: CS and Economics student at Brock University
basics.summary:
Currently completing a BSc with Double Major in Computer Science & Economics from Brock University.

Software engineering professional primarily interested in full-stack and back-end software development with a passion for cloud technologies and code that scales. 

Brock Chess executive, Brock AI executive, Brock CS member, Datathon volunteer. Always trying to stay active on campus and increase my exposure to various roles.

In my spare time you can find me playing Basketball, following the Toronto Raptors, and playing video games such as Civilization, WoW and League of Legends. 

Always feel free to reach out to me if you think I can help you in any way!

projects.name: aigaming_match_game
projects.summary: This code was created as part of the AIGaming Microsoft Sponsored Day Hackathon at BrockU 2019

projects.name: brock-ai-website
projects.summary: The student run hub for computational intelligence, computational neuroscience & neurocomputing at Brock University

projects.name: royaltree_ecj_cluster
projects.summary: Cluster based deployment of Royal Tree problem using ECJ

work.summary: Research Assistant under Prof. Naser Ezzati-Jivan.
highlights: • Researching scalable systems, root cause analysis and software tracing.

work.summary: On the API & Application Development Team
highlights: • Created cloud-native translation app, used NodeJS and Google Cloud APIs/Functions to save the company $150,000/year.
• Built Microsoft Teams Bot for translate app with NodeJS, GCP, Docker, and Kubernetes, reduced translation time by 99%.
• Connected internal transcription application with Five9 API using NodeJS to transcribe 1000s of company voicemails.
• Designed application diagrams using LucidChart/Drawio, introduced 100% automated test coverage with Mocha.
• Collaborated in an agile manner with cross-functional team sprints, participated in 100% of daily scrums.

work.summary: Lab Assistant in the newly founded Digital Scholarship Lab
highlights: • Contribute to open source projects hosted on GitHub, manage pull requests, and code reviews (github.com/BrockDSL).
• Automated scraping journal website, parsing and cleaning the data using Python, connected app to CouchDB database.
• Managed the lab, taking responsibility of all faculty, staff and students within the lab
• Deployed Genetic Algorithm Royal Tree program to HPC mini-cluster written in Java using ECJ and wrote a departmental white paper on results for proof of concept
• Act as a student liaison for connecting the DSL to other organizations on campus
• Help develop and run workshops for R, Python, Tableau, Git, PowerBI and Jupyter Notebooks

work.summary: Developed SaaS web applications using ASP.NET, C#, and JavaScript, following an agile approach for the largest provider of administrative health solutions in Canada.
highlights: • Engineered automation system for web form development using C# (NUnit), TSQL and TFS, cutting front-end development time by 75% and reducing referential integrity errors by 90%+.
• Modernized flagship product to fit current browser standards, introduced CRUD functionality using C# and ASP.NET.
• Developed Web Forms for the ePCR system using Gridbox, Jquery/Javascript, HTML and CSS.
• Created xWiki for internal documentation, scaled down required meetings accelerating on-boarding by 70%.

work.summary: Managed over 40 websites using Adobe Suite, HTML, CSS in WordPress & Drupal
highlights: • Regularly met with clients to help them translate their requirements into solutions
• Worked independently and remote 95% of the time, allowing for increased flexibility around meeting with management and clients

education.description: Double Major in Computer Science and Economics
education.activities:
Relevant Computer Science Coursework: 
Advanced Data Structures, Artificial Intelligence, Web Development, C++ with Applications, Computer Architecture, Algorithms, Object-Oriented Programming

Relevant Economics Coursework:
Microeconomics 1, Macroeconomics 1, Calculus 1, Statistics, Economics of the Illicit Drug Trade, Discrete Math, Discrete Structures

volunteer.summary: Directed all club operations in co-operation with the executive team.
highlights: • Fielded 2 teams to chess club to Canadian University Chess Championships
• Facilitated club membership growth from 5 members to over 100 during tenure,
• Promote the Datathon on campus by staffing tables and meeting with various organizations on campus

volunteer.summary: Founded first AI Club on campus, recruited executive team of 10, directed club operations.

highlights: • Achieved 3rd place in Microsoft AI Gaming Hackathon(git.io/Jvkxk).
• Wrote recognition in Python for a match game by utilizing Microsoft Azure Cognitive Vision api
• Analyzed JSON data and iterated logic to increase efficiency and accuracy of game matching
